## Bio

**Álvaro Zorrilla Carriquí** is a Data Science and Artificial Intelligence specialist with a rigorous academic background in Physics and Mathematics from the University of Granada. He holds a Master’s Degree in Data Science and Computer Engineering, where his research on diffusion generative models applied to medical imaging was recognized with the Best Master's Thesis Award.

Professionally, he has excelled as a researcher at GENYO, focusing on the development of innovative AI models for personalized medicine. During this time, he independently developed a classification algorithm for prostate cancer treatment stratification, which is currently under patent application. His expertise includes designing bioinformatics pipelines, handling large-scale data, and utilizing High-Performance Computing (HPC).

Beyond research, Álvaro has demonstrated his competitive edge by winning the Cajamar University Hack Datathon and being named a finalist in several national AI and bioinformatics conferences. He is proficient in Python, R, and C++, holds a C1 English certification, and has experience as a private tutor in scientific disciplines.

Currently, he is pursuing a PhD degree at Universidad de Granada about Technologies of Communication and Information, belonging to the group for Signal Processing and Biomedical Applications (SiPBA). His research focuses mainly on developing prediction algorithm for the thermal behaviour of power transformers, although he collaborates with biomedical-related projects.

The full CV is available in both [Spanish](cv_spanish.pdf) and [English](cv_english.pdf)
